page.title: 04C.M.Coastal Area (East)
page.content: To the NE of C.M. Beach the National Trust Coast Path runs from Lester Point, along Lester Cliff and above Wild Pear Beach which is accessible by a steep zig-zag path. The cliff path leads up and over Little Hangman hill which is an outstanding geological feature of the area giving it's name to a type of sandstone known as Hangman Grits. The path continues above Blackstone beach to Great Hangman. Here iron,copper and manganese were formerly mined and laver (edible seaweed) was gathered on the beaches. This is a conservation area of great beauty within the confines of the Exmoor National Park and has fine coastal views. Over 100 different grasses and wild flowers are to be found here including the rare Marsh Orchid.
